channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: A 200-Year-Old Precedent Holds the Key to Trump’s Troop Deployment
item.description: The administration says the ruling, stemming from the seizure of an old mare, forbids judges from second-guessing his use of the National Guard.

item.title: Novo chairman to step down in board rift over pace of change
item.description: The move is part of a wider shakeup at the maker of Wegovy and Ozempic drugs, with more than half of the board members set to depart.

item.title: Millionaire tax that inspired Mamdani fuels $5.7 billion haul in Massachusetts
item.description: In two years levying a 4% surtax on incomes over $1 million, it's funded bridge repairs, bolstered literacy programs and tackled a transportation defi...

item.title: Man Who Wrote ‘So I Raped You’ Is Sentenced to 2 to 4 Years in Prison
item.description: Ian Cleary sent Facebook messages to Shannon Keeler six years after he sexually assaulted her when they were college students in Pennsylvania, prosecu...

item.title: Salesforce revamps Agentforce to try to pull customers across the gap between AI capabilities and AI adoption
item.description: Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff acknowledges enterprises need hand-holding to build effective AI agents

item.title: Trump Said to Demand Justice Dept. Pay Him $230 Million for Past Cases
item.description: Senior department officials who were defense lawyers for the president and those in his orbit are now in jobs that typically must approve any such pay...

item.title: OpenAI unveils its Atlas web browser in a bid to supplant Google as the internet’s universal starting point
item.description: ChatGPT Atlas looks and works much like a standard web browser but infuses generative AI capabilities throughout the experience.

item.title: How the Democratic Brand Turned Radioactive in Rural America
item.description: The political scientist Suzanne Mettler examines the roots of America’s urban-rural divide and how Democrats can win back rural voters.

item.title: Stolen Louvre Jewelry Worth Over $100 Million, Paris Prosecutor Says
item.description: The eight pieces are unlikely to garner that price if they are split apart or melted, the prosecutor said Tuesday.

item.title: ‘If there’s no bottom rung on the ladder, it’s really hard to leap up’: Nonprofits focused on Gen Z employment get $25m Citi Foundation windfall
item.description: Citi Foundation identified youth employability as the theme for its $25 million Global Innovation Challenge this year.

item.title: Vance Lands in Israel as U.S. Tries to Shore Up Gaza Cease-Fire Deal
item.description: Vice President JD Vance appeared undeterred by recent flare-ups of violence in Gaza, and he declined to set a deadline for when Hamas must disarm.

item.title: How the Louvre Jewelry Heist Unfolded
item.description: In just eight minutes, thieves stole priceless jewelry from the Louvre Museum on Sunday after using a truck-mounted ladder to break into a second-floo...

item.title: A Nepali Town Mourns a Native Son Who Died a Hamas Captive
item.description: The family of Bipin Joshi, a student, had campaigned internationally for his release and had held out hope until the end that after two years in Gaza,...

item.title: Stolen Louvre Jewelry Worth Over $100 Million, Paris Prosecutor Says
item.description: The eight pieces are unlikely to garner that price if they are split apart or melted, the prosecutor said Tuesday.

item.title: Portraits of China’s Changing Work force
item.description: In a nation grappling with economic uncertainty and sweeping demographic change, Chinese workers are reinventing themselves in unexpected ways.
